reviews.review_msg: Not a considerate person. Does not care about his students. Conceited for no reason.
He is making one of the hardest courses very engaging. Super responsive and kind. The best part that he is a nice person, which is a rare thing at SFU. Take Robin if you can!

Robin is funny, so lectures are engaging, but the weekly political tangents get tedious. Homework is easier than the exam, which he tells you the questions for—but they're tricky, so do lots of textbook practice. Reading the textbook isn't very helpful, and the slides are quite simple, so it is hard to catch-up if you miss a lecture.

Robin's lectures are very engaging (although he does enjoy talking about politics...)-- his in-class practice examples are well-thought out, and it's clear that he knows what he is doing. Also, a genuinely nice guy. Would recommend!

Very test heavy; to do well, do as many practice questions as you can, and be prepared for tricky details on tests!
Fun. Enjoyable. Actually enjoyed his class and participate all class although participation not mandatory. Strongly recommend.

Exams are pretty tough and very time-constrained with low averages, but he will tell you what type of questions will be on the exams. In order to do well stay on top of practice Q's, Wiley HW, and pre-readings. Overall 10/10 guy. Hilarious and good lecturer.

Robin is a terrific prof! He is super entertaining and covers all material in a clear manner. Exams are definitely tough and time-constrained, so lots of practice is required. Make sure to do and understand all the homework and self-study problems. He gives you the exact format of the exam, so focus only on what he mentions. Textbook reading helps!
Great Prof

Robin is humorous and provides good advice and tips to aspiring CPAs within his lectures. He was considerate to students by recording lectures and omitting part of the final that had a tech error. Weekly homework assignments and quizzes were time consuming, but good practice. Exam questions are the same as the homework and examples from class.

This professor is young and keen and handsome haha. It is so important to have a good acct prof so you do not have to chew on textbook. His slides have everything you need to get a good grade on the course. He is so good at teaching! I wish we have more acct professors like him.

Some students like Scott because he is young and fun. When it comes teaching, he is not very good. His lecture slides often have errors. He lacks confidence in answering questions in lecture. He has trouble explaining material. He covers material briefly, never going into much detail. It is noticeable that he is not too knowledgeable in the course.

I took this class during what I believe was Scott's first semester teaching it. The class material is dry but Scott does a good job injecting some humour into his lectures to make it more entertaining. His lecture slides are clear and concise. He is also clear about what to study for on the exams; there are no surprises and the exams are fair.
Wondering how he can give the same % marks for all the assignments in a course. Not sure if he pays attention to the details.
Don't take him. enough said

nice guy. very flexible with students. appreciate his effort to make accounting fun and relevant. however, lectures too quickly. can seem somewhat arrogant by saying that accounting is "easy". seems like the type that has favourites. overall, mehh

Very nice guy, passionate about accounting. learnt a lot from him. class itself might be hard for some student but if you do all the in class examples and HW you will do fine. Lectures were extremely helpful. I would recommend taking class with him. FYI he got Phd in accounting when he was 26 years old.
fyi, he doesnt mark the exams/assignments himself...theres a desingated marker who got paid to do nothing but mark these stuff
teaching is meh. exam difficult is fair. has attitudes towards students for sure. i wonder why ppl say he's a good prof and passionate towards acct/teaching.
Funny commercials he plays during breaks are fun. Sadly, only reason I went to class...

This guy is truly a great accounting professor.  The class was easy with him.  He teaches really well, and with even minimal effort, you can do well in this class.  Also makes it fairly interesting and the exams cover material that is 100% expected from the lectures.  Take this class with this prof.!!!
Great Prof! Explain the concept clearly. I learn a lot from him. Also, he is very approachable and friendly to his students. He even tries to know every of his student's name.
Unbelievably fast marker. I think we got our midterm grades back in 1-2 days. Teaching is meh...

He drops a number of hints during lectures so it  pays to attend. I can't shake the impression that he rewards brown nosing. He was evasive and unwilling to answer questions about a class case study for our group but, more than helpful for another group's member who fawned over him relentlessly. Decent but, should watch the perception of favortism.
Great guy. Tries to get to know all his students. Lectures are never dull as he tries to make it entertaining via short clips, jokes..etc. Exams aren't easy tho and require a fair amount of studying.

Excellent prof. Makes course material easy to follow; offers tips and hints if you pay attention in lectures. Relates material very closely to the business world and even extracts f/s from corporations to illustrate the concepts better. All in all, very interesting and passionate prof. Layout of tutorials are also very well planned out.

Put in the work! If you attend lectures, understand tutorials, and do the self-study questions he assigns, you won't be surprised with the exam questions. Very clear and straightforward with what will be tested. Clear lectures, helpful slides, and open to questions. Likes people who participates on WebCT, I wouldn't call that brown-nosing.
No Comments
Read directly from Slides

Exams are easy if you do all the assignments on your own and pay attention in class. He can be a bit unclear when explaining certain concepts due to his accents or what not but overall he does try hard to help you understand. A nice and fair prof
Exams are not very hard if you do all the assignments. His lectures will help you understand many concepts and he teaches some tricks and some techniques which is good. Very good prof overall.
GOOD
Love him
He is the best Acc prof at SFU.
he is so nice but he presentations waste time. do the assignments for the midterm and exam.
he's such a nice guy, love him

If you want a grade of A- or better and if you did below avg on the midterm, you better particpate in class, do well in the class presenations and do all the homework 3 times. well thats my true stORY of 321. Teacher knows the material well.  Midterms are a killer but final exam was much more easier. If you want to take 321, take it with ;0
No Comments
Dun be too picky. He is not bad and pretty easy. I think he tried his best to explain the material in class even though noone is listening.

He uses monotone & broken English. During tutorial, present HW w/ P.Pt & report; he would sit there and criticizes it. He comes up with lame excuses when I asked for help.  He would call YOU instead of your name. I ask him to post extra questions before mid-term & he said “No need to do extra questions because is useless and a waste of time.
